name: Lake Vyrnwy Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another Travelzoo deal, one night in April, DBB and very good value it was. A most comfortable room with everything you need (at the back unfortunately) but not a problem as all public rooms are at the front so plenty of opportunity to take in the fabulous views. The 5 course dinner was excellent but extra vegetables cost £2.95 each dish and aren't really necessary as the main course already comes with some sides; the wine list is comprehensive but over-priced. Breakfast was also good with plenty of choice although the waitress would have done better if she'd written down our order! All in all we enjoyed our stay and would certainly return.
reviews.title: Most enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room 16 was spacious with a lovely view of lake, bathroom also overlooked lake. Very clean, cosy hotel. Thought it was a cheek to ask us to pay £10.00 each for the spa, good but small. hotel guests should not have to pay. Dinner in resturant was very good. Main course arrived with no vegtables so then had to pay £2.95 for green beans. Would stay again on another offer
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here early may for 2 nights with the offer travelzoo had on. The hotel is in a lovely area, overlooking the lake. We upgraded our room on arrival to a lake view and were so glad, as the view is amazing. I can safely say its the best view I've ever had from a hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This deal included a 5 course evening meal, and again was outstanding. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the tables overlook the lake.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are good, large with a big bed (I found the mattress a bit too firm but my girlfriend didn't). Bathrooms good, clean and with a nice big shower cubicle.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel three times now and love it a bit more each visit! Avoid the room above the kitchen at all costs though as this is very small, very hot and very noisy. This was the only down side of one stay, but the rest of the hotel, food, location and ambience made up for our disappointment. Our two subsequent visits have been greatly enjoyed - the newly decorated rooms are a vast improvement in style and comfort. If I could live here I actually would! Love the views of the lake and the hills, love the comfy lounge area with the real fires and twinkly lights, love the drawing room and the stylish furnishings, love the high quality food and love the friendly, helpful staff. My only slight critisism would be that the Tower Bar has had an overhaul and turned into a brightly lit bistro - I prefered the low lit comfort of the decor as it was previously. We will visit again and again!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Stayed for birthday dinner bed and breakfast, excellent staff and wonderfully food, also tried spa totally relaxing
reviews.title: Wonderfull setting a definate go back to place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We took my parents here for 2 nights to celebrate their 60th Anniversary. We wanted to give them a short break to remember and so we chose the Lake Vrynwy Hotel.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At reception, we were greeted by the 2 charming, friendly and efficient receptionists. I had booked a room with disabled facilities for my parents and their room was on the top floor accessed either by the stairs, (not suitable for my parents), or a disabled platform lift located in the Spa. This is the only point that stopped me giving this lovely hotel 5 stars. To reach the lift, you had to leave the reception and walk perhaps 50 metres up a small slope outside of the hotel to get to the Spa and the lift.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location and Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had warned me about this when I booked and they did locate a wheelchair for my mother to use during our stay, but it would have been much better if there had been access inside of the hotel or even by a covered walkway rather than having to walk outside exposed to the elements, even worse when your dressed for dinner in the evenings and it's raining!
reviews.title: Lovely Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed her just before Easter on a Travelzoo offer ( 1 night, Dinner and B and B ). What a find .....a really laid back old fashioned Hotel with all the modern-day facilities ! It is so relaxing and you just want to sit back in the really comfortable chairs and sofas and look at the view !!Our booked room was a Garden room but we upgraded just £10. and it was worth it . We had room 7 which was a big room with lovely bathroom, you even had a view of the lake whilst sat on the loo and also from the bath !!! The room had all the facilities and toiletries you could wish for.
reviews.title: What a Gem !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner was fabulous and the staff really take good care of you and you feel really pampered. Breakfast was great too and all these meals come with a lake view !! I really would recommend this Hotel, you can forgive the little hole in the armchairs as this all adds to the charm of the place !! Will definitely be going back !!
reviews.title: Perfect for Romance and Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a truly romantic and relaxing short break at this "old world", traditional hotel with spectacular views to rival any Italien Lake! My husband booked this break as a surprise present for me for Mother's Day- a rare treat to get away without our young children! We have always wanted to stay at this hotel and the experience became possible with a very good value 2 night Travelzoo offer. The hotel is full of traditional charm and although a little "tired" in places, as described in other reviews, we just felt this acted as a reminder of the origins and age of the building! Our room was just everything we hoped it would be with enormous comfortable bed, large bathroom with bath, shower and extremely "fluffy" towels and a balcony overlooking the stunning lake and surrounding mountains, from which we enjoyed a bottle of champagne and the view! The food in both the hotel and Tavern "pub" was excellent and was only rivalled by the friendliness and professionalism of the staff, who evidently work very hard and do all that they can to make your stay as special as possible. The Spa is a must at this hotel! Where else in the UK can you enjoy such stunning scenery whist lying on a heated lounger in your swimming costume with the rain pouring down outside? Staff once again friendly and helpful but unobtrusive and the Ytsanga treatment was bliss! We can't wait to return!
reviews.title: What a find !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Lake Vernwy Hotel totally by chance ,after spotting a special offer ,but , my goodness we will be back .We have many short breaks during the year,and this will be a regular.
reviews.title: Stunning location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was amazed to see a bad comment recently written ,surely they werent staying at the same hotel !!Yes perhaps some of the main rooms were slightly "shabby chic ", but our bedroom was wonderful, A lovely huge room with beautiful sitting area ,super king size bed ,and luxury bathroom ,and amazing views .
reviews.title: Ideal for a short break away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First visit via travelzoo and would definitely go again. Got there early but no problem accessing room. Staff friendly. Room really nice we had booked room with balcony overlooking lake and if the sun had shone could have stayed there all day! Dinner fine and breakfast has home made jams. Did not use spa. Second night ate in the Tavern and really enjoyed the food there too. All staff helpful and pleasant. Lovely walks around lake.
reviews.title: Great break, fantastic views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our second visit in two months and unlike the first, we left with a sour taste in our mouths. Yes, as other reviewers have said the views are spectacular, the food very good, the premier rooms very spacious and worth paying for, the staff accommodating and the ambience of the hotel perfect. They don't readily adevrtise that they accommodate children, but highchairs/cots/z-beds are available for free, and a children's menu is also available in the bar. I don't think they get many young children staying here, but the staff were all very friendly and accommodating in this regard. As with all such places, a few minor improvements could be made; it's the little things that count as noted below, however, it was the manager's 'couldn't care less' attitude which has unfortuantely put us off returning again.
reviews.title: A disappointing return visit after a wonderful first visit two months ago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked the 'Sunday night, stay Monday for £1' deal which included afternoon tea on arrival (delicious homemade scones spolied by sweetened cream, not clotted as you would expect), a five course 'gourmet dinner' (very good but you had to pay extra for a side, which you needed as the portions were small, extra for a cheese platter etc.) and a 'spa ritual in the comfort of your room' ( a tray of luxury bath products containing bath creme, exfoliator, cooling gel & moisturiser with a handful of petals for the bath water and two cups of Green Lemon tea), a nice relaxing treat. Breakfast was also very good with excellent quality, locally-sourced ingredients.
reviews.title: Lake Vyrnwy Hotel and Spa - wales

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But there are downsides, not least of which is the ridiculously late check-in at 4pm. (However, we were travelling with a toddler and due to the appalling weather didn't stop en route as planned so were due to arrive two hours earlier. We rang when an hour away to ask if the room could be availble to accommodate our earlier-than-planned arrival and they kindly obliged). But be aware this isn't guaranteed and has to be requested so it is impractical to book a spa treatment on your arrival day before 5pm as you obviously need to unpack before-hand.
reviews.title: Birthday treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the spa. I booked a 40-minute treatment for 5pm while my husband looked after our daughter. The plan was, once I had finished my treatment, I could then look after our daughter while he visited the thermal suite prior to getting ready for dinner which was booked for 7.00pm. A bit of a rush, but with such a late check-in this was the only timetable possible to fit it all in. However, on arrival at the spa, I was told they were running 'a few minutes late' and directed to the waiting area (no magazines to read, just a price list of treatments and products available). I kept being apologetically told 'a few minutes longer' until finally at 5.30 they were ready for my treatment. It was very good (a back wrap with moor mud and deep massage, expertly performed by Elliwy, the Spa Manager) and highly recommended albeit rather expensive, as are all the treatments). But the long delay meant that by the time I returned to our room my husband didn't have time to visit the spa, which was very disappointing and neither his nor my fault. I mentioned this to the girl on the spa reception as I left, and she just shrugged her shoulders. So I mentioned it to the Hotel General Manager the next morning. I was rather curtly told that the spa operates a strict adherence to appointment times and he had never known of such a delay and couldn't imagine how it had happened. Given his disdainful manner he may as well have called me a liar. Nevertheless, he said he would speak to the spa manager and get back to me. By the time of our departure the next day, he still hadn't got back to me, so I approached him about it again. He told me he had tried unsuccessfully to speak to the spa manager so the issue was unresolved but he hoped it wouldn't put us off returning!
reviews.title: Great location for a romantic break

description: Built in 1890, this privately owned 4 star Victorian Country House Hotel & Spa is elegant, yet relaxed. Positioned on the fringe of Snowdonia within a 24,000 acre nature reserve, the hotel offers a unique and incomparable setting: hosting one of the most famous picturesque backdrops in Mid Wales. The hotel has 52 individually decorated bedrooms, 35 affording lake views and some with special features such as balconies and four posters.
